channel.title: Middle East on The Yankee
channel.description: Recent content in Middle East on The Yankee

item.title: The Muslim Heroes in Iraq - No One Left Behind
item.description: Link: http://nooneleft.org/ In 2014, during the Iraqi warring conflicts, over 20,000 people died in one year. More than 6,000 of them were civilians. Ever since the U.S. entered the conflict, the death toll has thus reached over 500,000 casualties. During this conflict, the U.S. received much help from local Iraqi civilians. Many civilians offered their assistance as translators and cooperators for the United States Military. These interpreters knew the area which Marines were dealing with, offering an important knowledge to the Marines.
